util.logging

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.logging.Logger

  • public final class Logger
extends Object
    A Logger logs messages. These messages are mostly from different parts of the application. For further information about loggers, see Logger.
    The Logger provides all functionalities to log those messages.

    To see/read those messages a Handler needs to be registered by calling the addHandler(Handler) method. And then again, the handler needs to have a Formatter which formats the log message.

    This class is a wrapper class around the Logger class of java.util.logging API. It masks several log methods to more intuitive names and hides other methods to stay simple.

    The following java.util.logging.Logger methods are masked:

    • Logger#severe(String) is masked by AbstractLogger.error(String)
    • Logger#warning(String) is masked by AbstractLogger.warn(String)
    Additionally Loggers can log on LevelX.DEBUG log level, a level between Level.CONFIG and Level.FINE.

    Author:
    Loris
    See Also:
    Logger, Level, LevelX

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        Logger(Logger log)
        Constructs a new Logger, with the given internal Logger.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(Class<?> clazz)
        Creates a Logger for the given class. The class parameter is used to name the logger, since loggers are settled in a hierarchical name space.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class for which this logger logs messages.
        Returns:
        A Logger for the specified class.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String name)
        Creates a named Logger. Usually class names are used to create logger names, but sometimes a logger needs a different name.
        Note: It is recommended to use the getLogger(Class) method in most use cases.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the logger.
        Returns:
        A Logger with the specified name.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of the internal java.util.logging.Logger name. This method gets forwarded to getName() and returns the method's return value.
        Returns:
        The name of the logger.
        See Also:
        getName()

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(Handler handler)
        Adds the specified handler to this logger. In particular, the underlying Logger gets the specified handler added.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler for handling log messages.
        See Also:
        Logger.addHandler(Handler)

      • config

        public void config(String msg)
        Logs a message with message level config. If this logger has a level config or higher enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • debug

        public void debug(String msg)
        Logs a message with message level debug. If this logger has a level debug or higher enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • error

        public void error(String msg)
        Logs a message with message level error. If this logger has a level error or higher enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • error

        public void error(String msg,
         Throwable thrown)
        Logs a message with message level error and given throwable. If this logger has a level error or higher enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        thrown - The throwable to give some details
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • getFilter

        public Filter getFilter()
        Returns the currently active filter for this logger. This may be null if no filter has set yet.
        Returns:
        The currently active filter or null if none was set.
        See Also:
        Logger.getFilter()

        public Handler[] getHandlers()
        Returns the registered handlers of this logger.
        Returns:
        The registered handlers of this logger.
        See Also:
        Logger.getHandlers()

        public Level getLevel()
        Returns the currently enabled level of this logger.
        Returns:
        The currently enabled level of this logger.

        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • log

        public void log(Level level,
       String msg)
        Logs a message with specified level. If this logger has the specified level (or higher) enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        level - The level of the log
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • log

        public void log(Level level,
       String msg,
       Throwable thrown)
        Logs a message with specified level and associated throwable. If this logger has the specified level (or higher) enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        level - The level of the log
        thrown - The throwable associated with this log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • log

        public void log(LogRecord record)
        Logs a specified LogRecord.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(LogRecord)

      • removeHandler

        public void removeHandler(Handler handler)
        Removes the specified handler from this logger's handlers list. The specified handler will no longer receive log messages from this logger and thus will no longer handle those messages.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler to remove
        See Also:
        Logger.removeHandler(Handler)

        public void setFilter(Filter filter)

        public void warn(String msg)

        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • warn

        public void warn(String msg,
        Throwable thrown)
        Logs a message with message level config. If this logger has a level config or higher enabled, the message will be forwarded to all its registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        See Also:
        Logger.log(Level, String)

      • resetHandlers

        public void resetHandlers()
        Resets this loggers handler list. That results in a logger without handlers and thus no logs of this logger are forwarded.
